HttpsCertificate.Description: Enable this section if you want to enable SSL on Kestrel

AllowedLogLevels.Verbose: Verbose is the noisiest level, rarely (if ever) enabled for a production app.
AllowedLogLevels.Debug: Debug is used for internal system events that are not necessarily observable from the outside, but useful when determining how something happened.
AllowedLogLevels.Information: Information events describe things happening in the system that correspond to its responsibilities and functions
AllowedLogLevels.Warning: When service is degraded, endangered, or may be behaving outside of its expected parameters, Warning level events are used.
AllowedLogLevels.Error: When functionality is unavailable or expectations broken, an Error event is used.
AllowedLogLevels.Fatal: The most critical level, Fatal events demand immediate attention.

ClientCertificate.Description: Enable this section if you want to enforce certificate authentication for front-end to back-end
ClientCertificate.Subject: <subject name>
